For a discrete stochastic system with inputs (or hidden states) $\{A_i\}$ and outputs $\{B_j\}$, a decision rule for an observation $B_j$ gives a choice of corresponding input event $A_i$.
The decision rule may be chosen to optimize some function of the inputs and outputs (e.g., likelihood or APP).

For a stochastic system with a discrete input events $\{ A_0, A_i, \ldots \}$ and discrete output events $\{B_0, B_1, \ldots\}$, the maximum likelihood decision rule given $B_j$ was received is
$$ \hat{A}_i, \mbox{ where } i = \arg \max_{i \in \{0,1\}} P(B_j|A_i). $$

For a stochastic system with a discrete input events $\{ A_0, A_i, \ldots \}$ and discrete output events $\{B_0, B_1, \ldots\}$, the maximum a posteriori (MAP) decision rule given $B_j$ was received is
$$ \hat{A}_i, \mbox{ where } i = \arg \max_{i \in \{0,1\}} P(A_i|B_j). $$
